metadata.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering - ProcCreation
metadata.comment: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\shellids\\microsoft.powershell\\executionpolicy')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\policies\\microsoft\\windows\\powershell\\executionpolicy'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('bypass')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('remotesigned')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('unrestricted'))))

output.summary: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine
